str2: A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and anistemi; objectively, to produce, i.e. beget; subjectively, to arise, i.e. object.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
